intro: Syncarpha canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf synbranch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Syncarpha canescens typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought and heat.
